com.github.ctrimble.combinatorics
Interface CombinatoricHandler<T>

Type Parameters:
T -
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractCombinatoricHandler
public interface CombinatoricHandler<T>

An event handler for building a combination or permutation based on changes from the last combination or permutation. Events are fired in this order: start() init() evaluate() (( init() | swap() | replace() ) evaluate() ) * end()

Author:
Christian Trimble

Method Summary
 void end()
          Called when events have finished.
 void evaluate()
          Signals that a new state has been reached and it is time to evaluate the combination or permutation.
 void init(T[] state)
          Signals the replacement of all state information.
 void replace(T newValue, T oldValue, int i)
          Signals the replacement of a value in the current state.
 void start()
          Called when events are going to start.
 void swap(T newA, int ai, T newB, int bi)
          Signals the swapping of two elements in the current state.
 

Method Detail

start

void start()
Called when events are going to start.

init

void init(T[] state)
Signals the replacement of all state information. This method will be called at least once after start(), but can also be called during iteration.

Parameters:
state - the new combinatoric state.

swap

void swap(T newA,
          int ai,
          T newB,
          int bi)
Signals the swapping of two elements in the current state.

Parameters:
newA - the new value at position ai. This value is at bi before this call.
ai - the new index of newA.
newB - the new value at position bi. This value is at ai before this call.
bi - the new index of newB.

replace

void replace(T newValue,
             T oldValue,
             int i)
Signals the replacement of a value in the current state.

Parameters:
newValue - the new value at position i.
oldValue - the old value at position i.
i - the index that is being replaced.

evaluate

void evaluate()
Signals that a new state has been reached and it is time to evaluate the combination or permutation.

end

void end()
Called when events have finished.
